q: Courage is not having the strength to go on; it is going on when you don't have the strength.
h:
“Courage is not having the strength to go on; it is going on when you don't have the strength.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Create each day anew.
h:
“Create each day anew.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: The golden opportunity you are seeking is within yourself.
h:
“The golden opportunity you are seeking is within yourself.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: Find the game where you can win, and then commit your life to playing it; and play to win.
h:
“Find the game where you can win, and then commit your life to playing it; and play to win.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: What the mind can conceive, it can achieve.
h:
“What the mind can conceive, it can achieve.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: The only lost cause is one we give up on before we enter the struggle.
h:
“The only lost cause is one we give up on before we enter the struggle.” —
Vaclav Havel

q: It is up to each of us to sing as we feel moved by the overall song of life.
h:
“It is up to each of us to sing as we feel moved by the overall song of life.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Information changes your mind. Action changes your circumstances.
h:
“Information changes your mind. Action changes your circumstances.” —
Jack Butcher

q: There's no next time. It's now or never.
h:
“There's no next time. It's now or never.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Feelings come and go like clouds in a windy sky. Conscious breathing is my anchor.
h:
“Feelings come and go like clouds in a windy sky. Conscious breathing is my anchor.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: Honor is the foundation of courage.
h:
“Honor is the foundation of courage.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle.
h:
“Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle.” —
Plato

q: The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change their future by merely changing their attitude.
h:
“The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change their future by merely changing their attitude.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: If we are not able to smile, then the world will not have peace.
h:
“If we are not able to smile, then the world will not have peace.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: Quiet people have the loudest minds.
h:
“Quiet people have the loudest minds.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: You win more from losing than winning.
h:
“You win more from losing than winning.” —
Morgan Wootten

q: Meanings are not determined by situations, but we determine ourselves by the meanings we give to situations.
h:
“Meanings are not determined by situations, but we determine ourselves by the meanings we give to situations.” —
Alfred Adler

q: There is little success where there is little laughter.
h:
“There is little success where there is little laughter.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Wit is educated insolence.
h:
“Wit is educated insolence.” —
Aristotle

q: Do not believe that you will reach your destination without leaving the shore.
h:
“Do not believe that you will reach your destination without leaving the shore. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: The person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
h:
“The person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.” —
Albert Einstein

q: The only thing new in the world is the history you do not know.
h:
“The only thing new in the world is the history you do not know.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.
h:
“Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.” —
Og Mandino

q: The quieter you become, the more you are able to hear.
h:
“The quieter you become, the more you are able to hear.” —
Rumi

q: Optimism is the one quality more associated with success and happiness than any other.
h:
“Optimism is the one quality more associated with success and happiness than any other.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.
h:
“Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.” —
Ayn Rand

q: True wealth is of the heart, not of the purse.
h:
“True wealth is of the heart, not of the purse.” —
Og Mandino

q: Procrastination is one of the most common and deadliest of diseases and its toll on success and happiness is heavy.
h:
“Procrastination is one of the most common and deadliest of diseases and its toll on success and happiness is heavy.” —
Wayne Gretzky

q: The only limits in our life are those we impose on ourselves.
h:
“The only limits in our life are those we impose on ourselves.” —
Bob Proctor

q: Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.
h:
“Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Death walks faster than the wind and never returns what he has taken.
h:
“Death walks faster than the wind and never returns what he has taken.” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: Great thoughts speak only to the thoughtful mind, but great actions speak to all mankind.
h:
“Great thoughts speak only to the thoughtful mind, but great actions speak to all mankind.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.
h:
“Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.” —
Aristotle

q: Lust, anger and greed are the three gates to self-destructive hell.
h:
“Lust, anger and greed are the three gates to self-destructive hell.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: To injure an opponent is to injure yourself. To control aggression without inflicting injury is the Art of Peace.
h:
“To injure an opponent is to injure yourself. To control aggression without inflicting injury is the Art of Peace.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.
h:
“I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.” —
Mark Twain

q: A comfort zone is a beautiful place, but nothing ever grows there.
h:
“A comfort zone is a beautiful place, but nothing ever grows there.” —
Unknown

q: It's just a bad day, not a bad life.
h:
“It's just a bad day, not a bad life.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: Don't gain the world and lose your soul. Wisdom is better than silver and gold.
h:
“Don't gain the world and lose your soul. Wisdom is better than silver and gold.” —
Bob Marley

q: If you don't make things happen then things will happen to you.
h:
“If you don't make things happen then things will happen to you.” —
Robert Collier

q: The ability to hold two competing thoughts in one's mind and still be able to function is the mark of a superior mind.
h:
“The ability to hold two competing thoughts in one's mind and still be able to function is the mark of a superior mind.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: If the misery of the poor be caused not by the laws of nature, but by our institutions, great is our sin.
h:
“If the misery of the poor be caused not by the laws of nature, but by our institutions, great is our sin.” —
Charles Darwin

q: In the midst of movement and chaos, keep stillness inside of you.
h:
“In the midst of movement and chaos, keep stillness inside of you.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: He who permits himself to tell a lie once, finds it much easier to do it the second time.
h:
“He who permits himself to tell a lie once, finds it much easier to do it the second time.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Remember to look up at the stars and not down at your feet.
h:
“Remember to look up at the stars and not down at your feet.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: Adventure is worthwhile in itself.
h:
“Adventure is worthwhile in itself.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Do anything, but let it produce joy.
h:
“Do anything, but let it produce joy.” —
Walt Whitman

q: If I can pay the bills, I'm happy.
h:
“If I can pay the bills, I'm happy.” —
Morgan Wootten

q: Little by little, one travels far.
h:
“Little by little, one travels far.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Heaven is right where you are standing.
h:
“Heaven is right where you are standing.” —
Morihei Ueshiba
